articles.title: Kim Jong Un Inspects Pyongyang City Home for Aged under Construction
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Inspects Pyongyang City Home for Aged under Construction
						
 Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, gave field guidance to the Pyongyang City Home for the Aged under construction.
					 Accompanying him were Hwang Pyong So, Choe Thae Bok, O Su Yong, Ri Jae Il, Jo Yong Won and Kim Yo Jong.
					
					 The construction of the Pyongyang City Home for the Aged was proposed by Kim Jong Un, who said it should be a social trait, a habit of the whole country forming a big family, to look after those persons who are to be put under public care. And he solved all matters arising in the construction, from designing to supply of materials.
					
					 He recalled with deep emotion that President Kim Il Sung, together with leader Kim Jong Il, visited an old people's home in Mandal-ri, Sungho County in May 1948 when he was busy paving an untrodden path for nation-building and showed deep care for the inmates' living conditions, including quilts and bowls, saying that the state would take warm care of the aged.
					
					 Under the paternal love of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il the "DPRK Law on the Protection for the Aged" was adopted in the country and the Central Committee of the Federation for the Care of the Elderly of Korea organized and the Party and the state have wholly taken charge of aged people's health and life, he noted.
					
					 He said that to build the home for the aged well is a very important work in correctly implementing the Workers' Party of Korea's policy for the care of the elderly and fully displaying its validity and vitality.
					
					 Going round different parts of the home under construction, he learned in detail about its building operation and gave important instructions for the construction.
					
					 It is the constant demand of our Party to firmly preserve the Juche character and national identity in construction, he said, stressing that the exterior and interior of the home should be laid out to sustain the national character and emit the strong national flavor.
					
					 He added that a work should be organized meticulously to provide furniture and utensils needed for operation of the home and produce good uniforms for its employees.
					
					 The home is in an excellent location the Party valued, he said, stressing the need to build it into another model edifice in the era of the Workers' Party, an embodiment of the Party's love for the people.
					
					 The Pyongyang City Home for the Aged should be built as a prototype equipped with all conditions for its inmates to lead a happy life free from any cares and worries so that such homes can be constructed in localities with it as a model, he said.
					
					 He expressed belief that the soldier-builders would successfully complete the construction of the home by late June, true to the intention of the Party Central Committee, and thus honorably enter the venue of significant grand festival celebrating the 70th anniversaries of founding of the WPK and national liberation.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Congratulates Lao President on His Birthday
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Congratulates Lao President on His Birthday 
						
 Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, Friday  sent a congratulatory message to Choummaly Saynasone, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party and president of Laos.
					 Kim Jong Un in his message extended warm congratulations and comradely greetings to Choummaly Saynasone on his 79th birthday.
					
					 He noted that he is sincerely rejoiced over the great progress made by the friendly Lao people in their efforts to implement the decision made at the 9th Congress of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party and achieve the socio-economic development of the country under the correct leadership of the party headed by Choummaly Saynasone.
					
					 Expressing belief that the traditional friendly and cooperative relations between the two parties and countries would grow stronger in the joint struggle for independence and socialism against imperialism, he sincerely wished Choummaly Saynasone good health and fresh successes in his responsible work for the development of the party and the prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Birthday Spreads to Pak Il Man, Pak Jong Suk
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Birthday Spreads to Pak Il Man, Pak Jong Suk 
						
 Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un sent birthday spreads to Pak Il Man, department director of the Central Committee of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea (GFTUK), on his 80th birthday and Pak Jong Suk, resident in Ryugyong-dong No. 2, Pothonggang District in Pyongyang, on her 90th birthday. 
					 Pak Il Man was born when Korea was wrapped in the grief of statelessness, and in Japan after the liberation of Korea he devotedly worked for the development of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan true to President Kim Il Sung's idea on Juche-based overseas Koreans' movement.
					
					 After coming over to the socialist homeland, he became an official of the Pyongyang City Committee of the GFTUK and then the Central Committee of the GFTUK under the care of the peerlessly great persons. He was honored to receive a watch bearing the august name of Kim Il Sung and high official commendation.
					
					 Pak Jong Suk, born into a poor peasant family before the liberation of Korea, has devotedly safeguarded the leader following in her husband's footsteps who dedicated his life to the party, the leader and the country.

articles.title: DPRK Foreign Minister Urges U.S. to Roll back Its Hostile Policy towards DPRK
articles.content:
DPRK Foreign Minister Urges U.S. to Roll back Its Hostile Policy towards DPRK
 Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- Ri Su Yong, foreign minister of the DPRK, made a speech at the Geneva Conference on Disarmament on March 3.
					 He said:
					
					 Overall disarmament process remains deadlocked contrary to expectations of the member countries.
					
					 Arbitrary and double-dealing attitudes of some countries bring about negative consequences of sparking off an arms race, far from seeking genuine disarmament negotiations based on mutual trust among member countries.
					
					 The NPT was adopted at the disarmament talks in the last century but nuclear disarmament was not completely realized. Consequently, the nuclear map of the world today has significantly changed. Less people in the media and academic circles pay attention to this issue.
					
					 If the CD fails to sufficiently play its role any longer, the issue of nuclear disarmament may disappear from the UN agenda once and for all.
					
					 The Korean peninsula is a nuclear arsenal as the world's largest nuclear weapons state and the youngest nuclear weapons state are technically at war.
					
					 The Korean peninsula may be called a ground showcasing the consequences proving that a nuclear weapons state failed to keep promise made to non-nuclear state at a time when the NPT was adopted. 
					
					 Instead of providing assurances of non-use of nukes against the DPRK which acceded to the NPT in 1985, the U.S. has not de-escalated its nuclear threat to Pyongyang at all but further increased it.
					
					 The hostile policy of the U.S. towards the DPRK for over half a century, not just a few years, compelled the DPRK to have access to nukes. The DPRK cannot but bolster its nuclear deterrent capability to cope with the ever-increasing nuclear threat of the U.S.
					
					 The DPRK's future counteraction will depend on whether the U.S. rolls back its hostile policy toward the DPRK or not. 
					
					 As long as Korea remains divided, lasting peace on the Korean peninsula and the regional security cannot be ensured.
					
					 When Korea is reunified, it will definitely help realize the cherished desire of the nation and, at the same time, will be a decisive contribution to the peace and security on the Korean peninsula and, furthermore, those in Northeast Asia where the interests of big powers clash.
					
					 The DPRK will not spare its sincere efforts to bring about a great change in the inter-Korean relations this year.
					
					 The government of the DPRK expresses conviction that CD will pay due attention to the situation on the Korean peninsula and give support for the efforts to ease the tension.

articles.title: DPRK Acrobats Return Home
articles.content:
DPRK Acrobats Return Home 
 Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- DPRK acrobats returned home on Friday after proving successful at the 39th Monte Carlo International Acrobatic Festival.
					 Their physical acrobatics "Double Swing Flight" and "Balancing Etude" were awarded gold prizes at the festival.

articles.title: President of Sri Lanka Hopes for Stronger Ties of Friendship and Cooperation with DPRK
articles.content:
President of Sri Lanka Hopes for Stronger Ties of Friendship and Cooperation with DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- Kye Chun Yong, DPRK ambassador to Sri Lanka, presented his credentials to Maithripala Sirisena, president of Sri Lanka, on Feb. 26.
					 The president said that the two countries have long-standing ties of friendship, adding that the Koreans are a diligent and brave people and the DPRK has great scientific and technological potential.   He expressed hope that the long-standing friendly and cooperative ties between the two countries would grow stronger in all fields such as politics, economy and culture.
					
					 Sri Lanka remains unchanged in its consistent stand that the tension on the Korean peninsula should be defused as early as possible and Korea should be reunified through reconciliation and cooperation, dialogue and negotiations, he noted, wishing the Korean people greater success in their struggle to build a thriving nation and reunify the country.

articles.title: Lao Personages Plant Trees at DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Lao Personages Plant Trees at DPRK Embassy
						
 Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- The Committee for External Affairs of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party and the Laos-Korea Friendship Association jointly planted trees at the DPRK embassy in Vientiane on Feb. 27 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The visitors included Tong Yeu Tho, member of the C.C., the Lao People's Revolutionary Party, vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the National Construction Front of Laos and chairman of the Laos-Korea Friendship Association, Khamphanh Sitthidampha, member of the C.C., the Lao People's Revolutionary Party, president of the People's Supreme Court and vice-chairman of the Laos-Korea Friendship Association, and other personages concerned.
					
					 Ri Sang Gun, DPRK ambassador to Laos, and his embassy officials planted trees with those personages.

articles.title: Festival of Science and Technology of Kim Il Sung University Held
articles.content:
Festival of Science and Technology of Kim Il Sung University Held 
						
 Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- The 30th Festival of Science and Technology of Kim Il Sung University was held from Tuesday through Friday. 
					 Present at the festival were teachers, researchers and postgraduate students of the university. The festival involved a public presentation and exhibition of scientific and technological achievements, contest of unit-level exhibition and new technology sharing. 
					
					 The university has achieved valuable successes conducive to developing latest science and technology of the country, closely combining science and technology with production and thus putting the national economy on a new higher Juche, modern and scientific basis and improving the people's living standard. 
					
					 More than 290 achievements were presented at nine panel discussions and scientific and technological achievements displayed and there was a brisk exchange of a lot of intellectual products during the festival.

articles.title: DPRK Wins Top Prize at Figueras International Circus Festival
articles.content:
DPRK Wins Top Prize at Figueras International Circus Festival 
						
 Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- The 4th Figueras International Circus Festival was held in Spain from February 26 to March 2.  The festival brought together famous circuses and acrobats from 16 countries including the DPRK, Russia, Mongolia, Brazil, China, Spain, Ethiopia and Cuba. 
					 Gold Elephant prize, the top prize of the festival, went to "Aerial Trapeze," physical acrobatics staged by acrobats of the DPRK, at an awarding ceremony held on March 2. This number won first prizes at various international circus festivals. This time, too, they successfully presented movements requiring high technique, winning the admiration of jury members and spectators.  
					
					 The chairman of the festival organizing committee said:
					
					 I sincerely congratulate the DPRK's acrobats on taking the first place and winning the top prize of the festival. 
					
					 "Aerial Trapeze" took part in our festival for the first time and it stole the spotlight in it. 
					
					 Watching "Aerial Trapeze," Spanish people got a fresh understanding of the eye-catching reality of the DPRK. 
					
					 The head of the Russian circus said the DPRK's "Aerial Trapeze" retains the world title. 
					
					 The fresh and courageous "Aerial Trapeze" is a model of acrobatics as it gives delight and optimism to people, he said, adding:
					
					 Warm congratulations to the DPRK acrobats. 
					
					 The mayor of Figueras City said:
					
					  I am honored to award the top prize of the festival to the world famous aerial trapeze of the DPRK. 
					
					 Citizens of Figueras City were fully attracted by the aerial trapeze of the DPRK. 
					
					 I hope the DPRK circus will continue to take part in the Figueras International Circus Festival in the future, too.

articles.title: DPRK Will Take Resolute, Merciless Counteractions: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
DPRK Will Take Resolute, Merciless Counteractions: Rodong Sinmun
						
 Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Friday in an article blasts the U.S. and south Korean puppet forces for kicking off Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises for aggression. 
					 The bellicose forces at home and abroad are working hard to apply the "tailored deterrence strategy" to the drills and examine its efficiency during the maneuvers as they did last year and, on this basis, round off a new scenario for a war against the north in April, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 An opportunity of resuming dialogue and improving the relations between the north and the south of Korea has already been scuppered. Now that the Armistice Agreement was reduced to a dead paper, what remains to be done at present is to counter the fire with fire and nukes with nukes.
					
					 The DPRK will come out to take resolute and merciless counteractions as the U.S. and puppet forces chose confrontation, not dialogue.
					
					 It is the firm resolution and choice of the service personnel and people of the DPRK to make the U.S. imperialists keenly realize what its powerful strike and true war are like and give vent to the grudge pent up for centuries.
					
					 Victory is always in store for the DPRK and disgrace and ruin await the U.S. and its followers. The aggressors and provokers will be doomed to be forlorn wondering spirit before they realize the powerful war deterrent the army and people of the DPRK have bolstered for several decades.
					
					 The U.S. and puppet forces had better behave themselves, bearing in mind the final warning of the DPRK.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Accuses Japan of Its Move for Expanding Scope of SDF's Activities
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Accuses Japan of Its Move for Expanding Scope of SDF's Activities
 Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- Japan is going to enact the "national security law" to drastically increase the scope of activities of its "Self-Defence Forces" (SDF).
					 The present chief executive of Japan submitted its bill to the consultative council of the Liberal Democratic Party and the New Komeito Party.
					
					 Its keynote is to revise the "law on situation in surrounding areas" and the "law on cooperating with the UN peace-keeping activities" so that the Japanese government may decide on overseas dispatch of the SDF any time without any resolution of the UN Security Council or approval of the Diet. It also calls for expanding the scope of Japan's support to its allies to allow Japan to render assistance not to a country but to various countries and provide not only ordinary materials but weaponry and ammunition.
					
					 It was reported that the bill would soon be submitted to the Diet and formally adopted as a law.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Friday in an article observes in this regard:
					
					 Japan has put off its veil of "a pacifist state" and revealed its true colors as a militarist nation seeking reinvasion.
					
					 The ruling forces of Japan, getting upbeat with the largely beefed forces of aggression, now seek to realize their wild ambition for starting reinvasion of Asian countries by legalizing the overseas advance of the SDF and increase of its operation sphere under the pretext of "national security."
					
					 This was clearly evidenced by the fact that the Japanese reactionaries are set to completely delete the words "situation in surrounding areas" from the "national security law" in a bid to expand the SDF's operation sphere to the whole of Asia.
					
					 Japan has a crime-woven history in which it massacred Asians after occupying their countries through aggression and war in the past. It is not hard to guess what horrible crimes against humanity Japan will commit once it launches reinvasion.

articles.title: Forest Fire Causes Damage in S. Korea
articles.content:
Forest Fire Causes Damage in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- A forest fire broke out in Jongson County, Kangwon Province of south Korea Wednesday, according to south Korean KBS.
					 It reportedly spread till late night, causing heavy damage.

articles.title: Koreans in Japan Accuse Japan of Its Discrimination Policy, Human Rights Abuses
articles.content:
Koreans in Japan Accuse Japan of Its Discrimination Policy, Human Rights Abuses
						
 Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- The Korean Human Rights Association in Japan held a seminar in Tokyo on Feb. 28 denouncing Japan for its policy of discrimination against Koreans and human rights abuses.
					 Present there were Koreans in Japan and Japanese citizens.
					
					 Kim Pong Gil, chairman of the association, said that Koreans in Japan have suffered pain for decades due to the Japanese authorities' discrimination policy and gained their rights through struggle.
					
					 Japan is still discriminating against students of Korean schools, he noted, calling for bringing into light the essence of Japan's chauvinism.
					
					 The reporters referred to the case of attacking Kyoto Korean Primary School No. 1 of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan in December of 2009 by the ill-famed "Citizens' Society against Special Privilege of Koreans in Japan", an ultra-right conservative group.
					
					 They said Japan has due obligation to guarantee the students of Korean schools the right to learn as they are descendants of Koreans forcibly drafted by the Japanese imperialists in the past.
					
					 They urged the Japanese government to make reparation for national education on the basis of international agreements and recommendations.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Exploits Praised in Sri Lanka
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Exploits Praised in Sri Lanka
 Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- A seminar on leader Kim Jong Il's exploits took place in Sri Lanka on February 27.
					 W. A. Duminduwardane, chairman of the Committee of Self-Reliance Studies in Sri Lanka, said:
					
					 There are many great persons who made contributions to the progressive development of mankind in history. But no one could match Kim Jong Il who performed immortal exploits for the cause of global independence, possessed of unparallel great idea and leadership art.
					
					 He authored lots of famous works including "On the Juche Idea," steadily developing in depth the Juche idea. 
					
					 As a result, progressive mankind could have a great ideological and theoretical weapon in the struggle for building an independent and peaceful new world free from any domination, subjugation, aggression and war.
					
					 The most important of the exploits performed by him who victoriously advanced the cause of global independence was that he frustrated the moves of the imperialists to stifle the DPRK and firmly defended Korean socialism and regional peace and security with his unique Songun politics.
					
					 The DPRK's capability for self-defence grew stronger thanks to his Songun politics.
					
					 The DPRK had access to nuclear deterrent to cope with the nuclear threat of the imperialists.
					
					 Eventually, Korean socialism grew stronger and peace and security on the Korean peninsula and in the region were firmly guaranteed.
					
					 His cause is being successfully carried forward by respected HE Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The cause of global independence is sure to triumph thanks to the Songun politics of the DPRK.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Posted by German Organization on Its Website
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Posted by German Organization on Its Website 
						
 Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un's work "Let the Entire Party, the Whole Army and All the People Conduct a Vigorous Forest Restoration Campaign to Cover the Mountains of the Country with Green Woods" was posted by the Anti-Imperialist Forum of Germany on its website on February 28.
					 The work, published on February 26, Juche 104 (2015), clarifies the tasks and ways to cover the mountains of the country with green woods by conducting a vigorous forest restoration campaign with the entire party, the whole army and all the people involved.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recorre campo de construccion de Asilo de Ancianos de Ciudad de Pyongyang
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recorre campo de construccion de Asilo de Ancianos de Ciudad de Pyongyang
						
Pyongyang, 6 de marzo (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea dirigio sobre el terreno el campo de construccion del Asilo de Ancianos de la Ciudad de Pyongyang.
					Le acompanaron Hwang Pyong So, Choe Thae Bok, O Su Yong, Ri Jae Il, Jo Yong Won y Kim Yo Jong. 
					
					El Mariscal Kim Jong Un dijo antes que atender activamente a los individuos que necesitan el cuidado de la sociedad debe ser un ambiente social y tradicion de la gran familia de todo el pais, tomo la iniciativa de la construccion del Asilo de Ancianos de la Ciudad de Pyongyang y resolvio todos los problemas que se presentan en la obra, desde el diseno hasta el suministro de los materiales.
					
					El Mariscal recordo con emocion que el Presidente Kim Il Sung habia visitado en mayo de 1948, junto con el Dirigente Kim Jong Il, el asilo de ancianos situado en la comuna Mandal del distrito Sungho, en el periodo muy ocupado de la construccion del pais, ocasion en la cual  conocio en detalles de la vida de los ancianos tales como el uso de mantas y vasijas y habia dicho que el Estado cuidaria bien a los ancianos.
					
					Bajo el amor paternal de los grandes lideres, fue aprobada la "ley de proteccion de ancianos de la RPDC" y organizado el Comite Central de la Federacion de Proteccion de los Ancianos de Corea. Y el Partido y el Estado se encargan totalmente de la salud y la vida de los ancianos, asevero.
					
					Senalo que acondicionar bien el asilo de ancianos es un trabajo muy importante para ejecutar cabalmente la politica de nuestro Partido en materia de la proteccion de los ancianos y manifestar plenamente su justeza y vitalidad.
					
					Dando revista a varios puntos del campo de construccion, el Mariscal averiguo en detalles el estado de la obra y dio instrucciones preciosas para la construccion.
					
					Mantener firmemente el espiritu Juche y la nacionalidad en el proceso constructivo deviene la posicion invariable de nuestro Partido, subrayo y agrego que al construir el interior y el exterior del asilo deben dar destaque a resaltar la nacionalidad y el matiz nacional.
					
					Ordeno acelerar la construccion y organizar con escrupulosidad el trabajo para producir los muebles y utensilios necesarios a la gestion del asilo y los uniformes de los empleados.
					
					El solar de construccion del Asilo es el lugar apropiado apreciado por el Partido, dijo y exhorto a levantarlo como otro edificio modelo de la epoca del PTC en que sea encarnado cabalmente el amor de nuestro Partido por el pueblo.
					
					Y agrego que deben levantarlo como modelo  para que los ancianos disfruten de una vida dichosa sin envidiar nada a nadie y exhorto a  construir tales asilos tambien en otras localidades.
					
					El Mariscal Kim Jong Un expreso la esperanza y la conviccion que los constructores militares, muy conscientes de la voluntad del Comite Central del Partido, celebraran dignamente el 70o aniversario de la fundacion del PTC y la liberacion de la patria, al acabar con exito hasta fines de junio el Asilo de Ancianos de la Ciudad de Pyongyang.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un felicita a Bashar al-Assad
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un felicita a Bashar al-Assad
						
Pyongyang, 6 de marzo (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea envio el dia 4 un mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de la Republica Arabe de Siria, Bashar al-Assad.
					La misiva va como sigue:
					
					En ocasion del 52o aniversario de la Revolucion del 8 de Marzo en Siria, extiendo calidas felicitaciones a Vd., al amistoso gobierno y pueblo de la Republica Arabe de Siria.
					
					La Revolucion del 8 de Marzo en Siria sirvio de una oportunidad de cambio historico en el esfuerzo del pueblo sirio por el desarrollo politico y economico del pais.
					
					Convencido de que bajo su correcta direccion, el pueblo sirio rechazara desafios de las fuerzas hostiles interiores y exteriores y lograra victorias en la lucha por defender la soberania, la dignidad, la integridad territorial y la seguridad del pais, formulo votos por  buena salud de Vd. y mayores exitos en sus labores responsables.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un felicita cumpleanos de Choummaly Sayasone
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un felicita cumpleanos de Choummaly Sayasone
						
Pyongyang, 6 de marzo (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, envio el dia 6 un mensaje de felicitacion a Choummaly Sayasone, Secretario General del Comite Central del Partido Popular Revolucionario Lao y Presidente de la Republica Democratica Popular Lao.
					El texto senala como sigue:
					
					Con motivo de su 79o cumpleanos, le envio calurosa felicitacion y saludo camaraderil.
					
					Estoy muy complacido de que el amistoso pueblo laosiano lograra gran avance en la lucha por el cumplimiento de la resolucion del IX Congreso del Partido y por el desarrollo socioeconomico del pais, bajo la correcta direccion del PPRL, encabezado por usted.
					
					Convencido de que se ampliaran y se desarrollaran las tradicionales relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre nuestros dos partidos y paises en la lucha conjunta por la independencia antiimperialista y el socialismo, formulo sinceros votos por la salud y nuevos exitos en sus trabajos responsables para el fortalecimiento y desarrollo del partido y la prosperidad del pais.

articles.title: Secretariado del CRPP insiste en la disolucion inmediata del SNI de Sur de Corea
articles.content:
Secretariado del CRPP insiste en la disolucion inmediata del SNI de Sur de Corea
Pyongyang, 6 de marzo (ACNC) -- El secretariado del Comite por la Reunificacion Pacifica de la Patria publico el dia 5 la informacion no. 1084.
					La nota aclara que el suelo surcoreano se convierte en un mundo de los gangsteres del Servicio Nacional de Inteligencia (SNI) al igual que en el periodo del "poder" de la dictadura de "Yusin" (renovacion) y en la tierra donde se violan los derechos humanos de la peor manera que en el tiempo de nazismo hitleriano.
					
					A pesar de que se ha revelado recientemente la verdad de todos los complots inventados por el SNI, la mandataria surcoreana no castiga a los responsables sino los protege e incluso designo a Ri Pyong Gi, ex presidente del SNI, como jefe del gabinete de los secretarios de Chongwadae, critica la informacion y continua:
					
					La designacion de Ri, conspirador y fanatico elemento conflictivo y anti-reunificacion, significa que Park declaro abiertamente que recurriria mas a la dictadura de "Yusin" y la campana intrigante contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea practicando con el apoyo del SNI la dominacion basada en la inteligencia, las fuerzas policiales y el terror como hizo su padre.
					
					No se puede pensar en la democratizacion del Sur de Corea ni en la mejora de relaciones Norte-Sur si se deja intacto al SNI, fuente de complots, intrigas y maldades.
					
					Seria una gran estupidez si la mandataria surcoreana piensa que puede remediar la crisis de dominacion y mantener la estabilidad de su poder apoyandose en el SNI.
					
					Todos los que se dedicaron al complot politico y la dictadura fascista sufrieron un fin tragico.
					
					Por ejemplo, el dictador de "Yusin" murio a balazos tirados por su brazo derecho de la Agencia Central de Inteligencia, al cabo de practicar la dominacion fascista ateniendose a los aparatos intrigantes como ese organo de inteligencia.
					
					La mandataria surcoreana debe tener presente ese antecedente tragico de su padre.

articles.title: Canciller de RPDC senala factores que impiden cooperacion internacional en esfera de DDHH
articles.content:
Canciller de RPDC senala factores que impiden cooperacion internacional en esfera de DDHH
						
Pyongyang, 6 de marzo (ACNC) -- El canciller de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Ri Su Yong, pronuncio el dia 3 un discurso en la 28a reunion del Consejo de Derechos Humanos de la ONU.
					En el ano pasado, despues de ser aprobada en la reunion del Consejo de Derechos Humanos de la ONU la "resolucion" referente a los derechos humanos de la RPDC, se tornan cada dia mas evidentes la falsedad de los "testimonios" presentados por algunos paises y el hecho de que la campana de "DDHH" anti-RPDC partio de motivos politicos, comenzo el canciller coreano y continuo:
					
					El "problema de DDHH" de la RPDC surgio, fuera de la categoria de verdaderos DDHH, como otro asunto politico, altamente politizado en la escena internacional de DDHH.
					
					Lo problematico es que los paises, que tienen enemistad con la RPDC, y sus satelites tratan con prejuicios la situacion real de DDHH de la RPDC.
					
					Abusar del problema de DDHH en el objetivo politico es el factor mas grande que impide la cooperacion internacional en la esfera de DDHH.
					
					Ese fenomeno se representa ante todo en el uso del "problema de DDHH" en el derrocamiento del regimen sociopolitico de otro pais.
					
					Es hecho bien conocido que durante la Guerra Fria, EE.UU., tras darse cuenta de que no hay triunfador en la guerra nuclear, planteo el "problema de DDHH" pasando a la "estrategia de transicion pacifica".
					
					A fin de destruir el poder y el regimen de los paises que no le obedecen, intenta ante todo manchar en la arena internacional el regimen de esos paises, lo que es un metodo rutinario que sigue usando EE.UU. hoy tambien.
					
					Al darse cuenta de que sera dificil que resulte efectiva la politica de garrote sobre la RPDC que fortalecio extraordinariamente el disuasivo de guerra, EE.UU. recurrio desde el ano pasado a la campana "DDHH" anti-RPDC.
					
					Esta politica no es nada nueva.
					
					Al considerar desde el inicio de la Guerra Fria la Peninsula Coreana de Asia como campo de confrontacion entre el socialismo y el capitalismo, invirtio fabulosos fondos en el Sur de Corea y, al mismo tiempo, persiguio "derrumbar" el regimen de la RPDC usando todo los metodos como aislamiento y aplastamiento, bloqueo y asfixio, amenaza, chantaje y presion, etc.
					
					El otro factor importante es la selectividad y la pauta de doble rasero.
					
					Ahora, la escena de la ONU se utiliza a menudo como un patio en que unas potencias determinadas, junto con sus fuerzas seguidoras, reprimen selectivamente a los paises desobedientes.
					
					Si se permite de continuo ese fenomeno, se desapareceran las cooperaciones de verdaderos DDHH y la escena de la ONU se convertira en un lugar caotico de fraudes politicos y confrontacion.
					
					Recientemente, se revelaron en EE.UU. las torturas horribles cometidas sistematicamente por el organo gubernamental, lo que produjo gran revuelo en escala mundial. Pero, ese problema no se ha presentando en la ONU.
					
					Es que guardaron silencio los paises europeos que preferian presentar ante la ONU el problema de DDHH de otros paises.
					
					No se debe tolerar mas ese fenomeno que estorba los esfuerzos internacionales por la proteccion y fomento de DDHH.
					
					El Consejo de DDHH de la ONU debe someter y debatir como asunto urgente las torturas de EE.UU., de manera que se ponga punto final a la selectividad y las practicas de la pauta de doble rasero.
					
					Reconocemos que en la actualidad, la violacion de la soberania estatal, el uso de las fuerzas armadas, la amenaza con el uso de estas y la sancion y el bloqueo economico contra otros paises, constituyen una flagrante violacion de los derechos humanos de los habitantes de los respectivos paises.
					
					El Consejo de DDHH de la ONU debe esforzarse por prestar mayor atencion a tales fenomenos generalizados en la arena internacional que a la situacion de DDHH de los paises escogidos con fines especificos y por tomar medidas correspondientes.
					
					Para cumplir plenamente con su mision, el Consejo de DDHH de la ONU debe tomar la imparcialidad como la vida de su trabajo, al igual que otros todos aparatos internacionales.
					
					Como se trata el caso de que un funcionario publico pronuncio disparates politicos contra un digno Estado soberano, miembro de la ONU, tales como "debe ser cambiada su direccion"? 
					
					A traves de esto, podemos conocer si es imparcial o no el Consejo de DDHH de la ONU y lo observaremos con mucha atencion.
					
					La RPDC defendera firmemente su soberania estatal para proteger los derechos humanos del pueblo desde los atentados de las fuerzas hostiles y desarrollara el regimen socialista que sirve para el pueblo, asi como contribuira a la solucion del problema mundial de DDHH.

articles.title: Clausurado XXX festival cientifico y tecnico de Universidad Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Clausurado XXX festival cientifico y tecnico de Universidad Kim Il Sung
						
Pyongyang, 6 de marzo (ACNC) -- Quedo clausurado el XXX festival cientifico y tecnico de la Universidad Kim Il Sung con la participacion de los profesores, investigadores y cursantes de instituto doctoral.
					El festival se realizo de forma de presentacion y exhibicion de los exitos cientificos y tecnicos, el concurso de exhibicion por unidades y el intercambio de nuevas tecnologias.
					
					La Universidad alcanzo exitos de alto valor que permite desarrollar la ciencia y la tecnologia de punta del pais, poner en el nivel  mas alto la jucheanizacion, la modernizacion y la cientifizacion de la economia nacional vinculando estrechamente la ciencia y la tecnica con la produccion y contribuir a la mejora de vida del pueblo.
					
					Se publicaron mas de 290 exitos cientificos de 9 ramas, se exhibieron los datos cientificos y tecnicos por unidades y se intercambiaron muchos productos intelectuales.

articles.title: Acrobacia coreana recibe maximo premio del IV Festival Internacional de Circo de Figueras
articles.content:
Acrobacia coreana recibe maximo premio del IV Festival Internacional de Circo de Figueras
						
Pyongyang, 6 de marzo (ACNC) -- Se otorgo a una pieza de acrobacia coreana el maximo premio del IV Festival Internacional de Circo de Figueras.
					Al festival, transcurrido del 26 de febrero al 2 de marzo en la ciudad de Figueras, Espana, asistieron las entidades circenses y los acrobatas provenientes de 16 paises como la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Rusia, Mongolia, Brasil, China, Espana, Etiopia, Cuba, etc.
					
					Los ejecutantes de la acrobacia corporal "Vuelo giratorio en el aire", conocida ampliamente en el mundo por haber ganado los premios para el primer lugar en varios festivales internacionales, cumplieron con excelencia los movimientos muy dificiles causando la admiracion del jurado y el publico.
					
					En la ceremonia de premiacion efectuada el dia 2, los acrobatas coreanos recibieron el Elefante de Oro, maxima distincion del evento.
					
					El presidente del comite organizador del festival felicito sinceramente el exito alcanzado por la acrobacia aerea coreana.
					
					Subrayo que "Vuelo giratorio en el aire" fue estrenada en el festival ganandose gran popularidad.
					
					Recalco que a traves de ella, los espanoles pudieron tener una nueva concepcion sobre la realidad de Corea.
					
					El jefe del grupo circense de Rusia dijo que la acrobacia aerea de Corea tomo la hegemonia mundial.
					
					Agrego que el "Vuelo giratorio en el aire" es pieza ejemplar del circo que pone animadas y optimistas a las personas.
					
					Felicito calidamente a los acrobatas coreanos que recibieron el maximo premio del festival.
					
					El alcalde de Figueras dijo que le da mucho honor la oportunidad de otorgar el maximo premio a la pieza coreana de fama mundial.
					
					Agrego que los ciudadanos de Figueras se quedaron enamorados de la acrobacia aerea coreana.
					
					Deseo que el grupo circense de la RPDC continue participando en el Festival Internacional de Circo de Figueras.
